title: Under high pressure and hot business, QPS dropped bottom due to uneven flow control
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
v5.2.0

### What operating system and CPU are you using?
DBaaS aws
Default OLTP recommended setup

### Steps to reproduce
1ã€run sysbench prepare
sysbench --config-file=config oltp_insert --tables=512 --table-size=100000000 prepare
threads=512

### What did you expect?
QPS cannot have a large drop

### What did happened?
QPS dropped bottom
![flowcontrol](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84712107/131604270-e8122567-066d-41a1-9ec3-e3257c798faf.png)

comments_data.body:
under 1000 thread tpc-c 1k warehouse workload, severe performance degradation is observed caused by flow control

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2316425/132001033-672cb583-b78b-411b-b7c8-a6eba0df70da.png)

> @dbsid How much QPS degression?

110k QPS --> 65k QPS, around 40% degradation.
Why this bugfix is considered as an improvement in the [v5.2.2 changelog](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidb/stable/release-5.2.2)?
